Awesome tiny hole in the wall restaurant off La Rambla.  Amazing fresh seafood (get the seared prawns!).  Get there early to avoid waiting, and get ready to rub elbows with lots of locals, it's pretty small inside.  We ended up just sitting at the bar, but watching the chefs at work was well worth it.  Definitely try the sangria, it was the best I had in Spain (and it's pretty strong!).  The desserts were impressive as well, so order a couple and share.  We discovered this place our last night in Barcelona, but if we'd found it earlier we probably would have gone back more than once - it's that good!
